content: would be a good time to insert them somewhere near round 8 make sure they are on the flat side of the body not the bulging side also begin to stuff the body and continue stuffing as you decrease round 16 7 single_crochet decrease 7 single_crochet 2x 30 ​ round 17 decrease 3 single_crochet 6x 24 ​ round 18 single_crochet decrease single_crochet 6x 18 ​ round 19 decrease single_crochet 6x 12 ​ round 20 6 decrease 6 ​ finish off and weave in ends wing use white yarn worked flat make 2 row 1 chain 4 working in the back hump of each chain starting from the 2nd chain from hook half_double_crochet double_crochet ​ all in one st treble_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet all in one st finish off leaving a tail for sewing to the body 2 comb use red yarn worked flat row 1 chain 6 working in the back hump of each chain starting from the 2nd chain from hook half_double_crochet double_crochet ​ half_double_crochet all in one st slip_stitch half_double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet all in one st slip_stitch half_double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet all in one st finish off leaving a tail for sewing to the body beak use yellow yarn worked flat row 1 chain 4 sc3tog in the back humps of the 2nd 3rd and 4th chain from hook ​ finish off leaving a tail for sewing to the body assembly sew the comb to the top of the head sew a wing to each side of the body fold/roll the beak into a beak shape using the tail to sew it into shape if necessary and sew onto the front of the body please refer to the photos below 3
